property.name: description
property.value: Test that a NOTAM with a referred number that already exists, is not created separately, but rather the original data is overwritten by the new one.

property.name: description
property.value: Simulate sending NOTAMs of type N, R, and C from the Aimsl API to the Wings backend via a POST request to the aimsl inbound data endpoint. This test ensures the correct lifecycle transitions and relationships between NOTAMs are handled and stored in the database. Steps: 1. Send type N (new) NOTAMs: - Ensure type N NOTAMs are created with the status "V" (Valid). - Validate that they have no replacement (`replaced_by`) or cancellation (`cancelled_by`). 2. Send type R (replacing) NOTAMs: - Ensure type R NOTAMs are created with the status "V" (Valid). - Verify that the original type N NOTAMs are updated with: - Status changed to "R" (Replaced). - `replaced_by` field set to the referred number of the replacing NOTAM. - `cancelled_by` remains `None`. 3. Send type C (cancelling) NOTAMs: - Ensure type C NOTAMs are created with the status "E" (Cancelled). - Verify that the replacing type R NOTAMs are updated with: - Status changed to "C" (Cancelled). - `cancelled_by` field set to the referred number of the cancelling NOTAM. - `replaced_by` remains `None`. Validations: - Check the total number of NOTAMs in the database matches the input data. - Validate fields like `referred_number`, `nof`, `series`, `notam_type`, `location`, and `qline`. - Confirm that status transitions (V -> R -> C) occur as expected. - Ensure `replaced_by` and `cancelled_by` fields are correctly set for each NOTAM in their respective lifecycle stage. This test ensures a comprehensive check of NOTAM lifecycle management, including correct status updates and relationships between NOTAMs across type N, R, and C.

property.name: description
property.value: Simulate sending NOTAMs from the Aimsl API to the Wings backend via a POST request to the aimsl inbound data endpoint. This test ensures the correct parsing, validation, and storage of the NOTAMs in the database. Steps: 1. Verify that the database is empty before starting the test. 2. Prepare and send a POST request containing a payload of NOTAMs and SNOWTAMs. 3. Verify the HTTP response status to ensure successful processing of the request. 4. Fetch and validate the contents of the created NOTAM objects in the database. Validations: - Check that the number of NOTAMs created matches the input data. - Validate fields like `referred_number`, `nof`, `series`, `notam_type`, `location`, and `qline`. - Verify content fields such as `content`, `lower_limit`, and `upper_limit`. - Check validity periods (`valid_from_date`, `valid_from_time`, `valid_to_date`, `valid_to_time`). - Confirm the proper handling of estimation (`valid_to_est`) and time schedule (`time_schedule`). This test ensures that all NOTAM attributes are parsed and stored correctly and that edge cases such as "PERM" validity and estimation flags are handled as expected.

property.name: description
property.value: Test that an admin can delete a checklist. - Checklist created by officer. - Admin deletes successfully (204 response).

property.name: description
property.value: Test that an admin user can edit any officers 2A NOTAM checklist. - Officer 1 creates the checklist. - Admin successfully updates it.

property.name: description
property.value: Test failure when required reasons for yes/no questions are missing. - Expects checklist creation to fail with 400 status. - Validates no checklist is persisted on failure.

property.name: description
property.value: Test creating a 2A NOTAM checklist fully completed by the primary user. - Ensures that all questions are answered as expected. - Verifies the checklist is marked as finished. - Validates progress is 100%.

property.name: description
property.value: Test creating a 2A NOTAM checklist with partial completion. - Ensures that not all questions are answered. - Verifies the checklist is not marked as finished. - Checks the progress reflects partial completion.

property.name: description
property.value: Test retrieving details of a specific 2A NOTAM checklist. - Creates an unfinished checklist. - Fetches it via detail view (GET). - Validates checklist data matches the original submission.

property.name: description
property.value: Test that an expert (non-admin) can delete a checklist. - Checklist created by officer. - Expert deletes successfully (204 response).

property.name: description
property.value: Test listing multiple 2A NOTAM checklists. - Creates multiple checklists. - Lists them via GET and verifies all are returned and valid.

property.name: description
property.value: Test visibility of deleted 2A NOTAM checklists. - Creates multiple checklists. - Deletes one and verifies visibility based on user role and params. - Admin should see all (including deleted); others see only active.

property.name: description
property.value: Test that an officer cannot edit another officers 2A NOTAM checklist. - Officer 1 creates the checklist. - Officer 2 attempts to edit and is denied (403).

property.name: description
property.value: Test that an officer can edit their own 2A NOTAM checklist. - Creates an unfinished checklist and then updates it to finished. - Validates both creation and successful edit. - Confirms correct progress and completion status after update.

property.name: description
property.value: Test creating and editing a type select NOTAM checklist across different user accounts. - Officer 1 creates and partially fills out the checklist. - Officer 2 successfully completes the checklist as a secondary user (different account). - An expert attempts to modify the secondary user's data and is correctly denied (403). - The expert also tries to edit the checklist itself and is denied (403). - Validates proper permission handling when different accounts interact with the checklist.

property.name: description
property.value: Test that an admin can delete a 4A NOTAM checklist. - Checklist is created by an officer. - Admin deletes it successfully (204 response).

property.name: description
property.value: Test that an admin can edit another users 4A NOTAM checklist. - An expert creates the checklist. - Admin successfully updates it.

property.name: description
property.value: Test failure when required reasons for yes/no questions are missing in a 4A NOTAM checklist. - Expects checklist creation to fail with a 400 status. - Validates that no checklist is persisted on failure.

property.name: description
property.value: Test creating a 4A NOTAM checklist fully completed by primary and secondary users. - Ensures that all questions are answered as expected. - Verifies the checklist is marked as finished. - Validates that progress is 100%.

property.name: description
property.value: Test creating a 4A NOTAM checklist with partial completion. - Ensures not all questions are answered. - Verifies the checklist is not marked as finished. - Checks that the progress reflects partial completion.

property.name: description
property.value: Test retrieving details of a specific 4A NOTAM checklist. - Creates an unfinished checklist. - Fetches it via the detail view (GET). - Validates that checklist data matches the original submission.

property.name: description
property.value: Test that an expert (non-admin) can delete a 4A NOTAM checklist. - Checklist is created by an officer. - Expert deletes it successfully (204 response).

property.name: description
property.value: Test listing multiple 4A NOTAM checklists. - Creates multiple checklists. - Lists them via GET and verifies that all are returned and valid.

property.name: description
property.value: Test visibility of deleted 4A NOTAM checklists. - Creates multiple checklists. - Deletes one and verifies visibility based on user role and query parameters. - Admin should see all (including deleted); others see only active ones.

property.name: description
property.value: Test that an officer cannot edit another officers 4A NOTAM checklist. - An expert user creates the checklist. - An officer attempts to edit it and is denied (403).

property.name: description
property.value: Test that an officer can edit their own 4A NOTAM checklist. - Creates an unfinished checklist and then updates it to finished. - Validates both creation and successful edit. - Confirms correct progress and completion status after the update.
